newsitem.title: USA: What a World! adjusts 1996 results.
newsitem.headline: What a World! adjusts 1996 results.

text.p: What A World! Inc on Thursday said it released adjusted financial results for fourth-quarter and full-year 1996 at the request of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, changing the accounting method to that of a going concern from a liquidation basis.

On a going-concern basis, the company had a fourth quarter net loss of $1.2 million, or $0.57 per share, on sales of $4.4 million. That compares with a net profit of $285,519, or $0.13 per share, on sales of $3.56 million for the same period in 1996.
The fourth quarter of fiscal 1996 ended on February 3, 1996. The fourth quarter of fiscal 1995 ended on February 1, 1995.
For full-year 1996, the company had a net loss of $2.5 million, or $1.19 per share, on sales of $8.2 million. For 1995 it reported a loss of $561,217, or $0.26 per share, on sales of $5.5 million.

Previously, on a liquidation basis, the company reported a fourth quarter 1996 net profit of $276,668, or $0.13 per share. For the year it originally reported a net loss of $1.0 million, or $0.49 per share.
What A World said it previously announced that Natural Wonders Inc had agreed to acquire substantially all of What A World's operating assets and assume certain of its liabilities.
Natural Wonders is operating What A World's stores while awaiting shareholder approval for the sale agreement, What A World said.
